intro: Mastixia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited mastixia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain a sticky, aromatic resin. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforests and coastal areas. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
